metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5702 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
phpMyAdmin 4.6.x before 4.6.3, when the environment lacks a PHP_SELF value, allows remote attackers to conduct cookie-attribute injection attacks via a crafted URI.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5702` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

phpmyadmin - 4:4.6.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: phpmyadmin package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:4.6.3-1').
